channel.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command
channel.description:
I get this error when I compile my server source and my server's client, 2 months ago I could solve this instantly but I quit Mopar and now I forgot how to solve it. I'm pretty sure my environmental variables are set correct, but they could be wrong, I'm not totally sure. Which part of setting the variables would this error appear if they weren't right? Rep if you help me solve this,
[code]'javac' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue.....[/code]

item.source: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command

item.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

… my god…

@echo off color 2 @TITLE Revolution Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error :end color 4 echo Finished! pause exit

Read full topic

item.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Guthix_Rox Guthix Rox
item.description:
@Guthix_Rox wrote:

Just download the net beans one, and install it… Then use this as the code for the compiler…

@echo off
title Cuban0 Ftw's Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
pause

Read full topic

item.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command

item.description:
@Guthix_Rox wrote:

@echo off
title Guthix Rox
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_01\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
pause

Replace jdk1.6.0_01 with your jdk folder name…

item.source: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command

item.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Guthix_Rox Guthix Rox
item.description:
@Guthix_Rox wrote:

This should work… (Make a new text file)
Put this in it:

@echo off
title Cuban0 Ftw's Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_16\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
pause

Then save it as compile.bat, and put it in your server folder… Or I think you can replace the code in your non-working compiler.

Read full topic

item.title: Javac is not recognized as an internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @raped_by_who raped by who
item.description:
@raped_by_who wrote:

@echo off color 2 @TITLE Revolution Compiler echo ------------------------------- -------------------------------- if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error :end color 4 echo Finished! pause exit

That one was always my favorite compiler.
Finds your JDK Version for you.

Read full topic
